title: The Story of OpenAI and Sam Altman
description: A conversation explaining OpenAI's journey, ChatGPT's impact, and Sam Altman's leadership in simple terms.

script.speaker: Announcer
script.text: Welcome to another episode of Life is Beautiful by Satoshi Nakajima. Today's discussion is based on the Bloomberg article titled 'Sam Altman on ChatGPT's First Two Years, Elon Musk and AI Under Trump.' The link to the article can be found in our show notes. We'll learn about OpenAI, its leader Sam Altman, and how they're changing the world with artificial intelligence.

script.speaker: Student
script.text: I keep hearing about something called ChatGPT. What exactly is it, and who made it?

script.speaker: Teacher
script.text: ChatGPT is like a super-smart computer program that can talk to you, help with homework, write stories, and solve problems. It was created by a company called OpenAI, led by Sam Altman.

script.speaker: Student
script.text: How did OpenAI start?

script.speaker: Teacher
script.text: It's quite an interesting story! Back in 2015, Sam Altman and some other smart people had dinner meetings to discuss creating artificial intelligence that could be as smart as humans. At that time, many people thought this idea was crazy!

script.speaker: Student
script.text: Really? Why did people think it was crazy?

script.speaker: Teacher
script.text: Because in 2015, AI wasn't very advanced. It's like saying you want to build a rocket to Mars when airplanes were just invented! But Sam and his team believed it was possible, and they managed to attract many brilliant scientists who shared their dream.

script.speaker: Student
script.text: So what happened when they released ChatGPT?

script.speaker: Teacher
script.text: It was amazing! On November 30, 2022, they released ChatGPT, and within just two months, more than 100 million people were using it. That's like having one-third of all Americans trying your product!

script.speaker: Student
script.text: Wow! But I heard something bad happened to Sam Altman last year. What was that about?

script.speaker: Teacher
script.text: Yes, in November 2023, the board of directors - that's like a group of people who make sure a company is doing the right things - suddenly fired Sam Altman. It was quite dramatic because almost everyone at OpenAI disagreed with this decision.

script.speaker: Student
script.text: That sounds scary! What happened next?

script.speaker: Teacher
script.text: The employees at OpenAI really supported Sam. Almost all of them threatened to quit unless he came back! After four days of intense discussions, Sam returned as the leader, and they got a new board of directors.

script.speaker: Student
script.text: How does Sam run the company now?

script.speaker: Teacher
script.text: He spends a lot of time talking with his team, especially the scientists and engineers. He uses a chat program called Slack to stay connected with everyone, and he has lots of meetings to discuss new ideas and solve problems.

script.speaker: Student
script.text: What are they working on now?

script.speaker: Teacher
script.text: They're working on making AI even smarter! They just created something called Model o3 that can solve really complex puzzles. But they're facing three big challenges: making the AI systems bigger, getting enough special computer chips, and finding enough energy to power everything.

script.speaker: Student
script.text: That sounds complicated! Is Sam worried about these challenges?

script.speaker: Teacher
script.text: Actually, he's quite optimistic! He believes they can solve these problems. He's even working on a special energy project called fusion that could provide lots of clean power. But he's also careful to make sure AI is developed safely and responsibly.

script.speaker: Student
script.text: What does the future look like for OpenAI?

script.speaker: Teacher
script.text: Sam believes that within the next few years, they might create AI that's as smart as humans in many ways. He's working with the government and other companies to make sure this happens safely. It's an exciting time, but also one where we need to be careful and thoughtful about how we develop this powerful technology.
